questions.question: What is a chemical reaction?

choices.answer: A process in which atoms rearrange to form new substances
A process in which molecules are created from nothing
When a chemical gets mad at another chemical

questions.question: What are the reactants (beginning molecules) required for cellular respiration?

choices.answer: Glucose and amino acids
Oxygen and amino acids
Glucose and oxygen
Glucose and water

questions.question: What are the products (resulting materials/molecules) of cellular respiration?

choices.answer: Water, carbon dioxide
Energy and water
Amino acids and energy
Energy, water, and carbon dioxide

questions.question: Where does cellular respiration occur?

choices.answer: In Powerhouse Gym
In the cell membrane
In the mitochondria of the cell
In the chloroplast of the cell

questions.question: ______ are the building blocks of proteins.

choices.answer: amino acids
glucose
fiber

questions.question: What do cells need in order for cellular growth and repair to occur?

choices.answer: A well planned out schedule and action plan
Energy from respiration to combine amino acids into proteins
Water in order for the cells in the body to be healthy

questions.question: True or False: Air molecules need to be broken down so that oxygen can get into the cells.

choices.answer: TRUE
FALSE

questions.question: Starch is broken down into ______

choices.answer: Protein
Energy
Glucose
Water

questions.question: Why would it be difficult to exercise if the respiratory system is not working well?

choices.answer: Cells do not work well if they do not have enough oxygen.
Molecules from the air would be too large for cells to use
Digestive system would need more glucose (food) for energy

questions.question: Can an athlete exercise efficiently just by eating food with various molecules?

choices.answer: No, her stomach cells need food molecules to work properly
No, because all cells make all the molecules they need
No, cells need molecules from food and  air to work properly
Yes, cells only work with molecules from different foods

questions.question: In preparing for diving, what could be tested to see if a body is healthy enough for activity?

choices.answer: By checking the cells for different food molecules
By checking to see if a person is getting plenty of sleep.
By checking to see if cells have molecules from food and air
Air molecules in lung cells, food molecules in stomach cells

questions.question: Can a patient (with a healthy diet) exercise normally if the digestive system is not working?

choices.answer: No, food molecules not broken small enough for cells to use
No, food molecules not combining enough to use in cells
No, oxygen is not broken into small enough pieces for cell
Yes, as long as he can breathe, cells will get molecules

questions.question: What would happen to a healthy scuba diver if their gear broke during a dive?

choices.answer: He would be fine as long as he slept enough
He would be fine as long as he has food molecules
It would be difficult for cells to function without oxygen
It would not effect him since his cells do not need oxygen

questions.question: What is challenging for cells when hiking a mountain?

choices.answer: The body needs to  create more bloodcells to increase oxygen
Cells automatically die at a certain altitude
Cells need proper hiking gear for mountain climbing
Cells struggle to obtain food molecules at a certain height

questions.question: When hiking a desert valley, would a diet of solely protein provide cells enough energy?

choices.answer: Yes. The protein would provide enough energy for the cells.
No. Cells need glucose in our diet to release energy.
Yes, the amino acids would provide enough energy for cells.

questions.question: What is metabolism?

choices.answer: Chemical reaction that requires oxygen and glucose
The powerhouse of the cell
The process of breaking air molecules down to fit into cells
The body's use of molecules for energy and growth
